desc: Toggles a breakpoint on the current line in the editor.
Adds a conditional breakpoint at the current cursor location in the editor.
Adds a log point at the current cursor location in the editor, allowing you to log messages to the console without stopping the debugger.
A triggered breakpoint is a breakpoint that is automatically enabled once another breakpoint is hit.
Edit the hit count of a function breakpoint.
Removes a breakpoint in the editor.
Removes all breakpoints set in the editor.
Enables all breakpoints in the debugging viewlet of Visual Studio Code.
Disables all breakpoints in the editor.
Reapplies all breakpoints in the current session.
Opens the Debug view where you can launch configurations, view call stacks, and manage breakpoints.
Focuses the breakpoints view in the debug sidebar in VS Code.
Adds a data breakpoint based on a memory address in the debug viewlet.
